alert.note: Alert for Cheatham; Dickson; Hickman; Houston; Humphreys; Maury; Montgomery; Perry; Williamson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 11 at 6:06PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Dickson, southern Montgomery, north central Maury, northwestern Williamson, Cheatham, Houston, north central Perry, Humphreys and northern Hickman Counties through 700 PM CDT... At 604 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Tennessee Ridge to 11 miles southeast of Bruceton. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Dickson, Ashland City, Waverly, Centerville, Camden, Erin, Coopertown, White Bluff, Kingston Springs, Pegram, New Johnsonville, McEwen, Burns, Tennessee Ridge, Hurricane Mills, Fairview, Pleasant View, Charlotte, Vanleer and Cumberland City. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 134 and 192. Interstate 24 near mile marker 25, and between mile markers 29 and 30. Interstate 840 between mile markers 1 and 15. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Cheatham; Dickson; Hickman; Houston; Humphreys; Maury; Montgomery; Perry; Williamson
